text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This IRM has been revised to comply with the updated standards.
IRM 2.4.56, dated 1-1-2011, is superseded.
LMSB, SB/SE, TE/GE, W&I.

Code ISTSR
) Overview: This IRM section provides an overview of the ISTSR Command Code. and (
) Purpose: This IRM contains procedural steps for use of the ISTSR Code. An Innocent-Spouse-Tracker-Record is added to a module on IDRS whenever a Form
is ﬁled with the Service. (

) Audience: These procedures apply to IRS employees who are responsible the processing of Innocent Spouse records. These employees are located the following areas: Large & Medium-Sized Business, Small Business/Self- Employed, Tax-Exempt & Government Entity’s, and Wage & Investment. (
) Policy Owner: The Chief Information Officer (CIO) is responsible for ing all aspects of our systems that operate the nation’s tax infrastructure. (
) Program Owner: MITS. (
) Primary Stakeholders: Large & Medium-Sized Business, Small Employed, Tax-Exempt & Government Entity’s, and Wage & Investment. (

) Program Goals: This IRM provides the fundamental knowledge and proce- dural guidance for employees who work with Innocent Spouse cases .By following the processes and procedures provided by this IRM, employees process Innocent Spouse cases in a manner that follows IRS policy and dures while promoting the best interests of the Government. (
) ISTSR with no deﬁner is the access route to Command Code ISTSE, the mechanism to update Innocent Spouse cases. No (

) If the input passes validation, control is passed immediately to Command ISTSE. See IRM
for information about this command code. (

) ISTSR with Deﬁner A displays a case with all its data ﬁelds, stages and comments. The identiﬁcation and reference ﬁelds are identiﬁed by headers. A The stages and comments are stated with no breakout of individual data. purpose is to give a quick snapshot of an entire case so problems with that case can be evaluated. (

(01-01-2009) Using ISTSR With No Deﬁner
If the input passes validation, control is passed immediately to Command Code ISTSE. See IRM 2.3.77 for information about this command code.
If successful, the output screen shows relevant identiﬁcation data for the and a one-line entry for each stage and comment. See Exhibit 2.4.56–2.
IDRS Terminal (

) For comments, the employee number of person who entered the comment is displayed as well as the date of the comment was entered, the type of comment and the comment itself. For HC (change stage) comments or HD (deleted stage) comments, the comment displayed is the stage, stage date stage contents that were changed or deleted. (

) ISTSR with Deﬁner B displays a case with all its data ﬁelds, stages and comments. The identiﬁcation and reference ﬁelds are identiﬁed by headers. Deﬁner B The stages and comments are stated with no breakout of individual data. purpose is to give a quick snapshot of the current case data for easy review. (
) ISTSR with Deﬁner B is activated by inputting the Primary taxpayer’s TIN (formatted), the Module MFT and Tax Period, and the Case Filer-Code and Claim-Number. For exact placement see Exhibit
These ﬁelds will validated, and the user will be notiﬁed of any errors. (
) If successful, the output screen shows relevant identiﬁcation data for the and a one-line entry for each stage and history comment. See Exhibit
) For stages, the employee number of the person who entered the stage is displayed as well as the date the stage was entered, the stage number, the stage date and the data entered for that stage (

) For comments, the employee number of the person who entered the is displayed as well as the date the comment was entered, the type of comment and the comment itself. HC (changed stage) comments or HD (deleted stage) comments are ignored when creating this screen. (

) ISTSR with Deﬁner S displays a summary of all the active or inactive cases an account. It also allows the user to select a case to work with, and to Deﬁner S the Command Code and Deﬁner to be used to do the work. (
) ISTSR with deﬁner S is activated by inputting the formatted TIN. See Exhibit
) ISTSR with Deﬁner S create an display line for every case on every module that account, whether the case is active (Filer-Code P or S), inactive (Filer- Code Q or T) or archived (the last stage is
). The display line includes the MFT, Tax Period, Filer, Claim Number and the most recent stage. In addition, there is a slot to refer that case to another command code or deﬁner. See Exhibit

) Any of the cases displayed may be selected for processing by another command code or by another Deﬁner of command code ISTSR. By putting letter E into that slot, the case selected will be passed off Command Code ISTSE (see IRM
Section
). If D is put into that slot, the case will be passed off to Command Code ISTSD (for cases with a Filer-Code of P or S) ISTSDU (for cases with Filer-Code of Q or T) (see IRM
Section
). If A, or T is put into that slot, ISTSR deﬁner A, deﬁner B or deﬁner T will process that case.

ISTSR with Deﬁner B is activated by inputting the Primary taxpayer’s TIN (formatted), the Module MFT and Tax Period, and the Case Filer-Code and Claim-Number. For exact placement see Exhibit 2.4.56–1. These ﬁelds will validated, and the user will be notiﬁed of any errors.
If successful, the output screen shows relevant identiﬁcation data for the and a one-line entry for each stage and history comment. See Exhibit
ISTSR with deﬁner S is activated by inputting the formatted TIN. See Exhibit

) ISTSR Deﬁner T is designed to be used by Customer Service speaking with Taxpayers about their Innocent Spouse relief requests. It T provides them with a summary of the current status their request(s). If the Primary Taxpayer is inquiring, the status of all active requests for that are displayed. If the secondary taxpayer is the requestor, all cases for that secondary taxpayer are displayed. (

) ISTSRT Deﬁner T is activated by inputting the formatted TIN of the Primary Taxpayer. If the Primary is the taxpayer requesting the status, nothing else is required. If the Secondary Taxpayer is the requestor, his or her formatted must be input also. See Exhibit

) ISTSR with Deﬁner T produces a formatted summary of the current status of the case. Included in the summary is the MFT, Tax Period, Filer-Code, Claim Number and information about the current stage of the case. See Exhibit

ISTSR Deﬁner T is designed to be used by Customer Service speaking with Taxpayers about their Innocent Spouse relief requests. It provides them with a summary of the current status their request(s). If the Primary Taxpayer is inquiring, the status of all active requests for that account are displayed. If the secondary taxpayer is the requestor, all cases for that secondary taxpayer are displayed.

Each case selected will be identiﬁed by the headings and associated data. The current status of the case is determined by the last stage, or stages present for that case. If the case has been closed (Stage 30), it may take one of the three formats presented, based on the preceding stages. The ﬁrst format results if the previous stage was 29. The second format results from a previous stage of 12 (Final Determination), 16 (Appeals Determination) or 20 (Tax Court Decision). The third format is if the previous stage was something else. Two or three of these case presentations can appear on one screen page.
